title: Removal of directors by judicial proceeding
context: [ยง414-199] Removal of directors by judicial proceeding. (a) The circuit court may remove a director of the corporation from office in a proceeding commenced either by the corporation or by its shareholders holding at least ten per cent of the outstanding shares of any class if the court finds that: (1) The director engaged in fraudulent or dishonest conduct, or gross abuse of authority or discretion, with respect to the corporation; and (2) Removal is in the best interest of the corporation. (b) The court that removes a director may bar the director from reelection for a period prescribed by the court. &copy; If shareholders commence a proceeding under subsection (a), they shall make the corporation a party defendant. [L 2000, c 244, pt of ยง1]
